A large, heavily built cat that has a yellowish-brown coat with black spots, found mainly in the dense forests of Central and South America.
A large plant-eating marsupial with a long powerful tail and strongly developed hind limbs that enable it to leap.
A nocturnal primate with large eyes, soft fur, and a long tail, native to Madagascar.
A small carnivorous mammal with a long body and tail and a grizzled or banded coat, native to Africa and Asia.
A medium-sized toothed whale with a long tusk extending from the upper jaw, found in Arctic seas.
A large arboreal anthropoid ape with long arms and reddish-brown hair, native to Borneo and Sumatra.
A brightly colored tropical bird with a strong curved bill, often kept as a pet and capable of mimicking human speech.
A small wallaby with a short tail, found mainly in southwestern Australia.
A large, heavily built plant-eating mammal with one or two horns on the nose and thick folded skin.
A tailed amphibian typically having a moist smooth skin and living in water or on land.
A tropical American bird with a brightly colored plumage and a large bill resembling that of a hornbill.
A mythical animal typically represented as a horse with a single straight horn projecting from its forehead.

A large bird of prey with the head and neck more or less bare of feathers, feeding chiefly on carrion and reputed to gather with others in anticipation of the death of a sick or injured animal or person.
A burrowing plant-eating Australian marsupial with a chubby face and short legs.
A small insect-eating bird with a slender downward-curved bill, found in forests of Central and South America.
A mythical ape-like creature supposed to inhabit the Himalayas.
A large German dirigible airship of the early 20th century, long and cylindrical in shape and with a rigid framework.
A small insect, typically red or black, that lives in large colonies and is highly organized.
A large, heavy mammal with thick fur and a stocky build, native to Europe, Asia, and North America.
A large predatory semiaquatic reptile with a long snout, long tail, and short legs.
An extinct flightless bird that was native to the island of Mauritius.
A large bird of prey with a massive hooked bill and long broad wings, renowned for its keen sight and powerful soaring flight.
A bird of prey with long pointed wings and a notched beak, typically catching prey by diving on it from above.
A small to medium-sized antelope with a slender neck and horns, found mainly in Africa and Asia.
A doglike carnivorous mammal with powerful jaws and large teeth, native to Africa and Asia.
